snippet: In an address to the nation after a 40 percent fall in the value of Iran’s currency over the past week, Mahmoud Ahmadinejad said his country was facing a “psychological war” waged by the United States.
abstract: Pres Mahmoud Ahmadinejad admits that American-led economic sanctions on the country are partly to blame for a 40 percent fall in value of the Iranian currency; pleads with Iranians not to exchange their money for dollars and other foreign currencies, which he says only helps the 'enemy.'
lead_paragraph: In an address to the nation after a 40 percent fall in the value of Iran’s currency over the past week, Mahmoud Ahmadinejad said his country was facing a “psychological war” waged by the United States.

headline.seo: Ahmadinejad of Iran Ties Currency Drop to Sanctions
headline.main: Iran’s President Ties Recent Drop in Currency to U.S.-Led Sanctions
headline.print_headline: Iran’s President Ties Recent Drop in Currency to U.S.-Led Sanctions
